sections.title: Understanding Money Management
sections.content: Money management is the process of budgeting, saving, investing, spending, or otherwise overseeing the capital usage of an individual or group. It's not just about having money—it's about making your money work for you.

sections.title: Key Principle
sections.content: The foundation of all wealth building is spending less than you earn. This simple concept, when applied consistently, creates the surplus needed for saving and investing.

sections.title: The Money Management Framework
sections.content: Effective money management follows a simple framework: Track → Budget → Save → Invest → Protect. Each step builds upon the previous one, creating a solid financial foundation.

points.title: Income vs. Expenses
points.description: Understanding the difference between money coming in and money going out is fundamental to financial health.

points.title: The 50/30/20 Rule
points.description: A simple budgeting framework where 50% goes to needs, 30% to wants, and 20% to savings and debt repayment.

points.title: Emergency Fund
points.description: Having 3-6 months of expenses saved for unexpected situations provides financial security and peace of mind.

sections.title: Your Action Steps
steps: Track your spending for one week using an app or spreadsheet
Identify your fixed vs. variable expenses
Set one specific financial goal for this month
Open a separate savings account if you don't have one

sections.title: Pro Tip
sections.content: Start small but start today. Even saving $1 per day builds the habit that will serve you for life. The amount matters less than the consistency.
